title: FC Stade Nyonnais 1 - 2 Everton
body_text:
FC Stade Nyonnais 1 - 2 Everton
Everton took on Swiss second-tier side Stade Nyonnais at the Centre Sportif De Colovray in their first pre-season friendly as their week at the training camp on the shores of Lake Geneva winds up.
There were some chances for both sides in the first half but no goals.
Under-21 player Katia Kouyate, 19, opened the scoring after coming on as a half-time sub and he finished superbly off a good pass from Iwobi, hammering the ball into the roof of the net from a decent angle.
Francis Okoronkwo was fouled on a pass from Iwobi for a penalty that was slotted in by Neal Maupay who was then substituted, with Cannon and McNeil returning to the field along with Ryan Astley, Reece Welch and Billy Creillin replacing Virginia in goal.
Near the end, Crellin was beaten by a superb first-time volley after Hunt failed to clear the ball. And that's how it ended with a win for Everton.
Everton: Virginia (72' Crellin), Godfrey (72' Astley), Tarkowski (46' Doucoure), Keane (72' Welch), Patterson (46' Hunt), Iwobi (72' McNeil), Gana (46' Kouyate), Warrington, McNeil (46' Onyango), Maupay (72' Cannon), Cannon (46' Okoronkwo).
Subs not Used: Lonergan.
Reader Comments (137)
Note: the following content is not moderated or vetted by the site owners at the time of submission. Comments are the responsibility of the poster. Disclaimer ()

Glad they are winning and keeping a clean sheet.

A bit harsh blaming Keane for their goal, when in fact it was McKenzie Hunt who failed to control the ball for their striker to fire home.
46 Posted 14/07/2023 at 19:05:15
Standouts: Iwobi, Mc Neill and Kouyate.
Solid performances from Virginia, Warrington and Doucoure.
Dodgy performances by Michael Keane (concentration again !!), Godfrey (looked well off the pace) and sadly Tom Cannon who seemed slow to react to the chances he was presented with.
Final shout out to the streaming service and website monitors. Get your act together please or, if you can't do better, ask Michael and Lyndon for some advice.
First friendly. Let's see how the next game pans out.
47 Posted 14/07/2023 at 19:19:43
Meanwhile, when healthy we have more central midfielders than we'll know what do with: Gana, Garner, Doucoure, Onana, Gomes, Iwobi, and Dele if he's playing.
Anyone know the status of Dele and Calvert-Lewin recovering from injury? Dele's hip surgery recovery seems to have gotten lost in the much more important story about him the last couple of days.

Might sound like I'm being funny, but you do need to log in to your account first using your E-Mail and Password. I had no problems, and had a very good picture quality, although it was pretty obvious Darren Griffiths and Ian Snodin were doing commentary watching a telly in one of their houses.
By the way, did anyone try the "Test Clip"? If you could view this then you should have been able to access the game via Everton TV.
50 Posted 14/07/2023 at 19:51:11
I usually don't have any trouble logging in to the Everton site but, today, I believed I had logged in, but when I wanted to access the live stream, it went bonkers.
The Echo has written that Everton apologised for the loss of service and will refund those who paid to get the game but were unable to due to the technical issues.
51 Posted 14/07/2023 at 20:05:19

In fact the only problem I have is with this bloody website, because it's not half slow. Takes ages to access a thread, sometimes all I get is a blank screen, or half the thread / posts are missing before the page finally uploads fully.
Also takes ages to return to the home page. In fact it's taken me about 5 minutes just to type this post! Does anyone else have similar problems! I don't think it's my device because other websites I look at are pretty quick.
53 Posted 14/07/2023 at 20:25:52

54 Posted 14/07/2023 at 20:37:03
I watched a training video in the Swiss camp today and I think it was Kouyate who was repeatedly smashing rocks past the keeper, looked a really sharp finisher.
55 Posted 14/07/2023 at 20:49:29
He also showed blistering pace down the left touchline, leaving about three opponents in his jet stream, only to be finally up-ended after turning another one inside out.
I haven't seen any post-match interviews from Dyche yet, but I'm sure he will no doubt have said some good things about Kouyate. Only time will tell, I suppose, but he does look a promising prospect.
56 Posted 14/07/2023 at 21:13:38
I only watched the highlights but I am increasingly worried about the long-term future of Ben Godfrey. I know it's just the first game of pre-season but I just do not see a footballer of any reasonable quality when I watch him.
57 Posted 14/07/2023 at 21:59:31
58 Posted 14/07/2023 at 22:05:52
Result of no consequence.
Just a game for fitness training and opportunities for some youngsters to show they have something to offer.
The only game to take seriously will be the Sporting Lisbon game.
59 Posted 14/07/2023 at 22:10:30
Iwobi was good as were Tarkowski and Keane but they were against a really low opponent.
Godfrey must be sold, he never had the brain, and now the pace seems to have gone.
Kouyate was the best of the youngsters but he tries too hard, lots of cards will follow with that kind of playing.
I'm really out of words with Tom Cannon, two clear chances and no result. We must let him go.
New recruits are needed.
60 Posted 14/07/2023 at 22:11:07
61 Posted 14/07/2023 at 22:26:39
Although he did make a customary error, and had Billy Crellin to thank for keeping the game scoreless at the time!!
62 Posted 14/07/2023 at 23:11:33
We definitely need left back cover, a natural winger, a bit of creativity in the centre.
And a â€” wait for itâ€¦ striker.
Who knew???
63 Posted 14/07/2023 at 23:13:30
I've had the problem of being taken around in a circle and getting nowhere for years. Today, I had another go and, knock me down with a feather, got in right away.
It's the first time I've ever got in. I won't know if it's a one-off because I'm going to all the other practice games.
64 Posted 14/07/2023 at 23:45:07
65 Posted 14/07/2023 at 23:48:50
Only IwobI put in a shift first half. Tarkowski was blowing chunks after 5 minutes and one time I genuinely thought he was going to throw up. Warrington is the new Tom Davies, Godfrey was very poor and seemed to not know what his position was. Tarkowski kept having to go wide left and cover for a missing left-back.
McNeil was unlucky not to score after a great dribble but disappeared.
DoucourÃ© touched the ball twice when he came on second half. The younger players that were in the squad were all way below what we need to survive this season, none of them looked good or ready enough to step up.
I know it's only a friendly but I see nothing here to make me believe we are okay. And by the way, nine first-teamers played in that game. No Calvert-Lewin, why?
Anyone who sees good in that squad needs to go to Specsavers.
66 Posted 14/07/2023 at 23:57:05

I'm not sure that Dom is officially listed as injured.
70 Posted 15/07/2023 at 01:56:24
71 Posted 15/07/2023 at 06:03:42
I prefer to give the players, especially the younger ones, a little more time to show what they can do. But, everyone is entitled to their own opinion, of course.
72 Posted 15/07/2023 at 06:10:10
I was disappointed in Cannon's performance.
Seems Pickford and Onana are being pushed in the shop window.
73 Posted 15/07/2023 at 06:34:23
Yes, Dyche does prefer the old guard, and it worked with Joey Barton, but that was in the Championship, and we cannot keep signing players over 30, nevermind 35.
Please no one say "well Peter Reid, Paul Power etc worked out"; that was 40 years ago.
74 Posted 15/07/2023 at 07:21:29
A few observations.
On the training footage, Idrissa giving Iwobi a run for his money on the bleep test. Who says age is an issue? If you look after yourself, you can keep going. He sets an example.
No sponsor on the shirt. Are we changing again? Am I overthinking?
McNeil has a gifted left foot and is a tricky player. He is no Sheedy or Tricky Trev, but I am encouraged as to how he will develop. Still young and full of potential.
Cannon has raw potential, but not as ready as some desire. Give him time. Alongside Warrington and Mills, introduce them to the squad gradually and manage them. Don't throw them into the fire of high expectations.
That Kouyate goal was a great strike as was the Swiss team's reply. Great set-up from Iwobi.
Maupay looked lively. Yes, Maupay.
We still look a bit goal shy, but it's a preseason workout, so I won't read too much into it.
75 Posted 15/07/2023 at 07:22:26
We looked so much better with Mina in the team at the end of last season. Not just because of his defending but his calmness on the ball and ability to find a forward pass, often through the press. We don't have anyone else who can do that, or even close to it (except Branthwaite possibly).
It still pains me that we spent around £25M on Godfrey when we could have got Saliba or Gabriel; or maybe Botman, Guehi, Fofana, Tapsoba etc. So many good young centre-backs around and sadly we signed one who just struggles to position himself well and is not great in the air.
76 Posted 15/07/2023 at 07:31:31
Branthwaite has been given extra time off as has James Garner, following England's Under-21 Euro success. We won't see either until next week at the earliest.
77 Posted 15/07/2023 at 07:41:04
Calvert-Lewin is no longer in Germany, he has been in Switzerland with the squad. He is not yet deemed fit enough to get involved in any contact. But has joined in some of the fitness work being done.
Might (big might) be involved in the games next week, fingers crossed, because boy we need him badly this season. We are by far a better side when he is in for sure.
78 Posted 15/07/2023 at 07:46:53
79 Posted 15/07/2023 at 07:59:56
If this enables us to bring in our main attacking target(s) then it probably makes some sense.
When I've seen Kouyate in the U21s and U18s, he's always looked a threat â€“ although I think Okoronkwo has more to his game. Kouyate only got 2 goals in 32 U21 appearances last season though and at 19 he really needs to kick on.
Otherwise it might be a similar story to Manpala, Sambou and the lad who went to Kilmarnock(?) never to be seen again.
80 Posted 15/07/2023 at 08:18:31
Maybe there is a Rumour Mill amongst Everton Staff. But he is younger than Ashley Young and will be available to play more than Mina.
Fits in with Everton's threadbare policy. This transfer window has the feel of a side that has been relegated.
81 Posted 15/07/2023 at 09:46:57
The Godfrey left-back experiment needs to stop. He's just not got the skills to play in that position, and I think it's stunting his impact at centre-back. If he's not good enough at centre-back, move him on whilst we can still get a good fee.
Cannon is still raw. It's looking like another season in the Championship is best all round. I had hoped he'd be our 3rd-choice striker, but after yesterday, I don't think so â€“ admittedly just one game.
Virginia as back-up is properly concerning. If you thought Olsen, Robles etc were shakey, I think you're going to age about 10 years if he plays competitive footy.
Same on Warrington. Some promise, but again, he's nowhere near good enough yet.
The rest. Looked like the first pre-season game. Final ball and crosses were poor. Up front was wasteful, and you can see the usual striker deficiency that has haunted the Blues for years. Maupay is a waste of time against limited opposition.
Goals turn games. It's that simple, and we have none. That needs to be on the front door of Finch Farm will a clock counting down to deadline day.
Kouyate has some fine dribbling and pace, scoring a real good finish. One to see in the coming games if there are any positives
82 Posted 15/07/2023 at 10:25:17
83 Posted 15/07/2023 at 10:39:39
Stop-gap is just that and most, if not all, over 32-years-old players will need replacing sooner rather than later and we are not likely to be in a better financial position any time soon.
Some take a lot from pre-season training and then say they don't think pre-season matches show anything although the number of players used in this game gives the impression that it is only to give an indication of fitness levels.
84 Posted 15/07/2023 at 10:39:42
His home is a large detached house, does he want a larger house? Or move to another area? Or is he off to another club?
85 Posted 15/07/2023 at 10:41:29
86 Posted 15/07/2023 at 10:51:45
Good point. Mina also played 13 games last season and saved Everton from relegation. Evans didn't save Leicester.
87 Posted 15/07/2023 at 10:57:10
88 Posted 15/07/2023 at 11:06:29
Ferguson's benefit game was one, my great grandson aged about 8 at the time asked me to leave the game because he thought it was crap, he wasn't far wrong, I told him to wait until Rooney came on, we did and Wayne livened Everton's attack up, we still got beat. Richard Gough stunk in his Goodison debut in a preseason game but was the star man for the rest of the season.
The real proof is how the team performs when the season starts.
89 Posted 15/07/2023 at 11:23:13
Whether a young player we sell, an older player coming to the end or losing a talented, but frustratingly not-available-enough 28-year-old centre-back.
Last time I looked, we had an average squad age of just over 25.
Like most clubs, a mix of young promise, established players and wise heads.
I can only go off the footage, but there seemed to be a lot of emphasis on fitness and conditioning.
90 Posted 15/07/2023 at 11:23:14
91 Posted 15/07/2023 at 11:36:37
However, we won, we got precious few wins last season. So winning will breed confidence.
Nothing like going into the start of the season with loads of defeats, even if it's just friendlies.
Let's start the bar higher this season
92 Posted 15/07/2023 at 11:50:09
93 Posted 15/07/2023 at 12:19:31
He was absolutely awful the season before last and, despite the rehabilitation in Lille, I can't bear the thought of seeing him play again for us.
94 Posted 15/07/2023 at 12:33:22
95 Posted 15/07/2023 at 12:36:43
96 Posted 15/07/2023 at 12:39:07
I know football is about opinions, but perhaps Gomes's performances where the game passed him by, or he was dispossessed, or the silly fouls committed largely on account of his crab-like speed, have all been forgotten by Colin (#92) and others.
I wish him well but I never want to see him in an Everton shirt again.
97 Posted 15/07/2023 at 12:39:50
I know many on here (mystifingly to me!) don't rate him but, if we sell him, I wonder who will be taking on the creative burden?
98 Posted 15/07/2023 at 12:49:12
Players cannot be judged after this â€“ players are trying to get fit again and young lads are perhaps too eager to make an impact.
We won, we scored twice and no injuries reported. Next please!
99 Posted 15/07/2023 at 12:54:34
100 Posted 15/07/2023 at 12:58:07
The issue with Alex is his contract runs out in 11 months. He is supposed to have said he wants to play Champions League football. If he doesn't sign a new contract ,he needs to be sold this window so that we can get someone in who can match or better his goals and assists. Same goes for Gray, it's Thelwell's job to keep the plates spinning and this is the best way.
Of course the players may think differently and decide to ride it out to get a free move on a bigger wage in a year. Their priorities will be what's best for them first and Everton second.
101 Posted 15/07/2023 at 13:06:56
102 Posted 15/07/2023 at 13:09:52
It must also be mystifying to you that there doesn't seem to be any club rushing to sign him. Hopefully that is in the pipeline.
103 Posted 15/07/2023 at 13:40:19
I get the frustration with both of those players and have had it myself.
But.
Most of our midfielders have struggled in struggling teams at a mismanaged club throughout their time with us.
I don't think Gomes ever really got over that nasty injury. Physically and mentally. A shame, as he looked good when he first came on the scene. I thought he looked controlling at one of the Anfield derbies. I think it was the unfortunate Pickford one.
If this was the 80s, that vindictive and deliberate tackle by Son would not have gone unpunished by supporters or players. A Brian Marwood moment. Shithouse. Fuck the crocodile tears. He meant to harm the player out of frustration. I can't even put that down to a 50-50. He chased after him.
In terms of time and pace, when I watch, players in the Premier League arguably get more time on the ball than perhaps they would in the Championship or lower leagues.
Aside from when we play the likes of the Red Duracell Bunnies, whose battery was running low last season and City when they decide to press, a lot teams we go defensive and allow possession.
The problem is having options in front and runners to aim for. That has been one of the problems in my opinion. Without that, to retain possession, a player will instinctively turn sideways or backwards.
Keep the ball. Or punt it forward to the other team. That sounds very Graham Taylor.
As much as we need the midfield to be more creative, they need something to aim for.
James Garner will be next in line.
104 Posted 15/07/2023 at 15:29:30
The trouble is I suspect that unlike many of our fans the manager realizes how important he is which is why he's been offered a large new contract.
But he's not signed it yet. Maybe because he doesn't fancy another relegation battle for fans who don't appreciate him.
If he doesn't sign then we'll have to accept one of those offers. And I think we'll miss him, even if you won't. Though if we get £15m for him and buy someone like Alex Scott I'll be content. The other issue may be that few other clubs will be willing to match the large wages we pay, though I like him a lot I don't think he's necessarily a £100k p/w player.
105 Posted 15/07/2023 at 15:32:10
I can assure you it was a real problem for many people trying to login to the site. I tried every device I had phone, laptop, ipad and pc and they all had the same response the login page would show but the took you back to the same login page.
I was very persistent and eventually it succumbed to me at half time.
Dave you were spot on about Michael Keane's lack of concentration. He allowed one of their players to run past him and but for Virginia coming out and just about blocking the shot it would have been a goal.
That has been MK's problem for years and if we persist in playing him next season don't expect the goals against column to be good.
Also Godfrey looks a shadow of the player that first came to us. It seems injuries, Covid and a lack of confidence have all atken their toll.
Very impressed with Kouyate though. He seems like a young Demarai Gray.
106 Posted 15/07/2023 at 15:35:56
Danny I love reading your posts but please, Monday morning, go right away to speck savers and get some new glasses because obviously your old ones are not working.
107 Posted 15/07/2023 at 15:37:53
He scored one goal for us in his initial loan season then none for the next three seasons. His lack of pace led to numerous free kicks on the edge of the box and not being able to get his passes away.
108 Posted 15/07/2023 at 15:54:42
109 Posted 15/07/2023 at 16:11:12
We won't know the answer to that question until the next season has ended, but, if you can find one of those three worse teams, could you please go on their sites and constantly post your negative thoughts about that club, because, I fail to see what you achieve with your posts, you're not alone, there are a little group of posters who seem to enjoy 'mocking' the club, the players, the manager, the board, the owner and sometimes even the supporters too.
Maybe the Talksport guy who was chastised by Jason Cundy was right, Evertonians would be happier had we been relegated as we might have been looking forward to winning games more regularly, rather than knowing we will likely lose more than we win in the top flight.
I even saw one so-called Evertonian on another site, who professed how happy he would be to see Everton be liquidated. It's something I just can't understand at all. If you don't like the club, why not go away and find something else to occupy your time?
110 Posted 15/07/2023 at 16:15:05
Yes, I think Iwobi's wages are the big issue, they could stop him from moving this season. He can't lose, he either gets his move and big wages or he hangs on and becomes a free agent and that's whether he's liked by Everton fans or not.
We all have our opinions I much preferred Aaron Lennon who wasn't particularly liked by a large portion of Everton fans, one man's meat is another man's poison.
111 Posted 15/07/2023 at 16:18:19
As things stand, we appear to have a very weak squad for this season's start and have a number of players who we really need to move on. It looks like it will be all very last-minute in the transfer market and we will need some inspired signings to plug the gaps in the squad.
However, just who leads the transfer negotiations in our current situation, I have no idea. If it's you-know-who, then that's the answer to your question.
112 Posted 15/07/2023 at 16:59:49
113 Posted 15/07/2023 at 17:08:37
Sell Iwobi as he has no place in this Everton squad with those numbers!
114 Posted 15/07/2023 at 17:15:42
If only it was possible to do the same with some of the negative posters on here.
115 Posted 15/07/2023 at 17:28:03
116 Posted 15/07/2023 at 17:30:38
Hallelujah, brothers! Negative posts are as welcome as positive ones. But the daily (hourly!) repetition of negative posts on exactly the same point, and across various threads, regardless of the original topic for the thread - why?
Seriously, just why?
117 Posted 15/07/2023 at 17:34:32
118 Posted 15/07/2023 at 17:58:26
Wigan and Stoke (Bolton is a night game) and Porto.
Before we know it, Fulham at home.
119 Posted 15/07/2023 at 18:13:40
120 Posted 15/07/2023 at 18:16:36
121 Posted 15/07/2023 at 18:19:23
122 Posted 15/07/2023 at 18:26:30
123 Posted 15/07/2023 at 18:58:17
Players need our support whether they are playing well or not. The Dele interview only shows that we never know what might be happening in a player's life that might be affecting their game.
Get behind the team!!!
124 Posted 15/07/2023 at 18:59:46
I can't stand the twitter threads “x player keep or sell discussâ€, so toxic.
125 Posted 15/07/2023 at 19:01:13
126 Posted 15/07/2023 at 19:11:30
No, that's just your opinion, which you are of course entitled to. However, the table doesn't lie over a full season, so we were not one of the three worst teams. Because, if we were, we would have gone down, simples.
Using your reasoning, do you think Arsenal, Liverpool and Man Utd were the best teams in the league also over the last few seasons? I think there are Man City fans & most fans of other clubs who would disagree with you.
127 Posted 15/07/2023 at 19:37:48
Watching the match in the 'stadium' yesterday it was plain for all to see we are severely lacking in centre-midfield, in particular someone who can put his foot on the ball and find spaces. We don't have that in Garner, Onana or Gana.
I do agree that he had a bad season under Lampard but it's simply not his game to go chasing and harrying and this is how Lampard deployed him.
A fit and refreshed Gomes wouldn't be the worst thing in the world. Perhaps not 'like a new signing' but I wouldn't dismiss him out of hand either.
128 Posted 15/07/2023 at 19:55:56
Doucoure I think gets the nod to partner him as he offers goals and aggression. Then it's Onana, Gana, Iwobi fighting it out for the remaining spot.
For me, that's not bad. You contrast that to left-back, right-winger and striker, and we've nothing much.
129 Posted 15/07/2023 at 20:05:25
130 Posted 15/07/2023 at 21:06:47
Losing on a free is not ideal, but also, we are still in a battle for survival.
He is one of the few first team players we have who we can be confident will perform for us this season, and if we lost him for a nominal fee and don't replace, we lose our most creative player and relegation is more likely without him than with him.
131 Posted 15/07/2023 at 23:45:08
Gomes can be pressurised too easily yielding possession and is often giving away possession by late tackles resulting in frees in dangerous situations.
132 Posted 16/07/2023 at 00:26:56
Obviously Iwobi will be offered a new contract as we try to protect our asset & attempt to keep an important first teamer.
The fear is him letting his contact run down and we lose him for nothing when we're already cash strapped.
133 Posted 16/07/2023 at 07:13:10
The possible reason Iowbi hasn't signed a contract is the Club is holding out in the hope that someone will offer money for him. That is normally the reason a contract is not signed during the Summer by a player at Everton.
I have realised that the Onana in reports is a goalkeeper from Cameroon, not our Onana. There appears to be no interest in him at the moment.
134 Posted 16/07/2023 at 08:27:06
Back on topic: Well done, lads, winning this knock about game. Hoping now to see some real progress in the remaining (slightly more challenging) pre-season fixtures culminating with a polished win against Sporting.
I live in hope more than expectation, I am sad to say!
